question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Max U64 Timestamp] Can exp_timestamp_secs equal u64::MAX causing overflow in subsequent timestamp arithmetic or comparisons? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: reconstruct_oauth_nonce()] [Empty EPK] Can an empty ephemeral public key bytes slice at line 148 cause pad_and_pack to fail or produce predictable hashes? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: get_uid_val()] [Empty UID Key] Can an empty uid_key string match unexpected claims in the BTreeMap lookup at line 216? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OidcClaims] [Missing Required Claims] Can iss, aud, sub, or nonce be empty strings passing deserialization but failing validation logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [IAT Future Timestamp] Can iat be set to a future timestamp, causing unexpected behavior in expiration calculations or allowing premature key usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [EPK Type Confusion] Can different EphemeralPublicKey types (Ed25519 vs Secp256k1) at line 58 produce different serialized forms affecting nonce reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [KeylessPublicKey Manipulation] Can fields in KeylessPublicKey (iss_val, idc) at line 59 be manipulated to bypass verification while maintaining valid signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_signature()] [JWK Header Mismatch] Can the kid or alg fields in jwt_header_json mismatch with the rsa_jwk parameter, causing verification with wrong keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Config Update Race] Can Configuration updates during transaction execution cause verify_jwt_claims to use inconsistent max_exp_horizon_secs values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Cross-Chain Replay] Can OpenIdSig be reused across different Aptos networks (mainnet, testnet, devnet) if chain ID is not included in nonce or IDC? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Provider Migration] Can users migrate between OIDC providers while maintaining the same identity, or does iss change break account access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Multi-Signature Attack] Can multiple valid OpenIdSig instances for the same transaction be used to bypass single-signature assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OpenIdSig] [Backwards Compatibility] Can changes to EPK_BLINDER_NUM_BYTES at line 43 break verification of previously valid signatures, causing funds lock? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: get_uid_val()] [Email Claim Missing] Can the email field at line 208 be None while email_verified is true, causing panic on unwrap or returning incorrect uid_val? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Whitespace in Claims] Can leading/trailing whitespace in iss, aud, sub, or nonce cause comparison failures or security bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_signature()] [Empty Signature] Can an empty jwt_sig vector pass verification by exploiting edge cases in RSA verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: reconstruct_oauth_nonce()] [Blinder All Zeros] Can an all-zeros epk_blinder at line 154 reduce nonce entropy or create predictable patterns in OAuth nonce? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: Claims] [Duplicate Claims] Can the same claim appear in both oidc_claims and additional_claims due to flatten, causing ambiguity in which value is used? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Numeric String Conversion] Can numeric aud or iss values in JWT be incorrectly parsed as strings, causing type confusion in validation? (Low)
